Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Cg-BigDef1 (natural AMPs; XXQ, 3S=S, UCSS1a, XXA, big defensin; mollusca/molluscs/mollusks, marine invertebrates, animals; JJsn)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (50.52%) toBjBDR: 13%; A: 11%. GRAVY: -0.55; Mol Wt: 10716.041; Mol formula:  C467H712N140O135S6; mol ex coeff: 23395.Chemical modification: N-terminus is a pyroglutamic acid, while the C-terminus is amidated. In addition, three disulfide bonds are formed: C1-C5, C2-C4, and C3-C6.Activity: active against Alcanivorax sp. 15.5817 (MIC 2.5 uM), Alteromonas sp. 15.5805 (MIC 1.25 uM), Aquimarina sp. LTB 128 (MIC 5 uM), Bacillus sp. 15.5814 (MIC 0.04 uM), Halomonas sp. 15.5829 (MIC 2.5 uM), Marinobacterium sp. 05.091-3T1 (MIC>10 uM), Marinomonas sp. 14.063 (MIC >10 uM), Marinomonas sp. 15.5827 (MIC 2.5 uM), Martellela sp. 15.5818 (MIC 2.5 uM), Pseudoalteromonas sp. 15.5809 (MIC 10 uM), Ruegeria sp. 15.5815 (MIC >10 uM), Shewanella sp. 15.5830 (MIC 1.5 uM), Sulfitobacter sp. 12.141-5T2 (MIC >10 uM), Tenacibaculum sp. 08.072-4T6 (MIC 1.25 uM), and Winogradskyella sp. 08.27-4T1 (MIC 1.25 uM). The inhibited strains are not identical to those affected by Cg-BigDef5, indicating specificity and complentarity.Synergy:AMPs: in addition, it showed strong synergy with Cg-BigDef5 against the Gram-positive Bacillus sp. 15.5814 with an FIC value of 0.35.Antimicrobial robustness: salt-insensitive: antimicrobial assays were tested at 400 mM NaCl (physiological condition). Provided by Charles Bevins. Est. 3/2023.
Literature Information.Author: De San Nicolas N, Asokan A, Rosa RD, Voisin SN, Travers MA, Rocha G, Dantan L, Dorant Y, Mitta G, Petton B, Charrière GM, Escoubas JM, Boulo V, Pouzadoux J, Meudal H, Loth K, Aucagne V, Delmas AF, Bulet P, Montagnani C, Destoumieux-Garzón D.2022
Literature Information.Title: Functional Diversification of Oyster Big Defensins Generates Antimicrobial Specificity and Synergy against Members of the Microbiota
